summary: Carbonara is a popular Italian pasta dish from the Lazio region. It's made with pork (often cured), hard cheese like pecorino romano, eggs, salt, and pepper. The dish became popular in the 1900s. Sometimes, other cheeses or pasta shapes are used. The origin is uncertain, but it might have come from combining eggs and bacon from Allied armies with Italian pasta after World War II.
title: Carbonara
